question: 動く
userAnswer: to: move/shift | function/work | take-action/act | be: touched/influenced
activeAnswer: to: move/shift | function/work | take-action/act | be: touched/influenced
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>move</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to move</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Someone is telling you <vocabulary>to move</vocabulary>. They are saying "<reading>you go</reading> (<ja>うご</ja>) over there. Move! Move!" If it helps, have them pronounce "You go" more like "Ugo."
